title: Problemi di visualizzazione mail
creator: salvatore.nicosia1
content:
Buongiorno, sto avendo dei problemi di visualizzazione di alcune e-mail su Thunderbird (ver 128.3.3esr 64bit) dove ho configurato varie caselle email IMAP con quasi tutte lo stesso provider. Con una visualizzazione impostata su verticale le email selezionate nel riquadro a sinistra non corrispondono con l'anteprima visualizzata a destra mescolando varie informazioni (mittente,oggetto,body,allegato ecc..) di altre mail precendenti/successive. (allego screen).

Inoltre avrei esigenza di avere le stesse etichette (sia di nome che di colore) su più macchine ma ho notato che è una funzionalità che forse ragiona in maniera locale e quindi etichettando una mail in un determinato modo su un PC non sempre avrò lo stesso risultato in sync su altro PC. title: Selected header does not match loaded body on IMAP
creator: mcswell
content:
My subject line is the same as one posted a year ago, which never received an answer, and is now archived. The problem is that I received an email a few minutes ago, but the body of the email displayed in Thunderbird is the un-formatted version of another email I received from a different sender four years ago.

Here's a few lines from the current email as displayed in Tbird:

>
> You might be interested in the ESLORA corpus of spoken Spanish. Websit= e:
> <a href=3D"http://eslora.usc.es" rel=3D"noreferrer" target=3D"_blank">= http://eslora.usc.es</a>
>

The email from which these unformatted lines were taken is correctly displayed in Tbird for that email; why it's showing up in my current email, and as unformatted (source) text, I have no idea.

I used a web interface to my email account to confirm that the body displayed in Tbird is NOT the body that was sent in this current email. In other words, Tbird is failing to display the body of the current email, and instead is displaying the unformatted version of a four year old email.

I tried moving the current email to a folder, restarting Tbird, but to no avail; it still thinks the text of the email is from an old message. Presumably a corrupted database, but why, or how to prevent this in the future,
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/130.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;solver_id:181052

title: Freeze when manipulating email in one folder only, since Nebula
creator: subs18
content:
Hi everyone,

Long time, happy TB user and supporter. A new problem has appeared with nebula that I am hoping that the experts here can help me troubleshoot.

When any operation is performed on the emails in one particular account's Inbox folder, there is a 3-5 second pause where TB freezes. For example, when I try to open an email, I see a blank email tab with `Loading Message...` for a few seconds, before the email shows; when I toggle the read status for an email in the folder by clicking on the gray/green icon, there is a few seconds' delay. During this pause I can hear my CPU fan speed up, so seems like there is a spike in CPU usage. After a few minutes, these delays go away, but then reappear at some point (even though TB has been open the entire time) - possibly after new email has been downloaded from the server.

My overall suspicion is that something in this particular folder's files is triggering Nebula. I need help figuring out what it is and fixing it. This is not bad enough for me to ditch TB but it's definitely annoying AF. Strange part is that it appeared only after the Nebula upgrade, which makes me think this is a code issue not a mailbox file issue.

Setup

  1. Thunderbird 128.3.3esr (64-bit) on Windows 11 23H2
  2. Multiple mailbox accounts, all using POP3 (not IMAP; there is no interaction between TB and the server other than downloading email). Had not changed any settings during the nebula upgrade
  3. The account in question has multiple folders in TB. Filters are used to move messages from the Inbox to different folders (and sometimes, to folders on other accounts). Again, the slow performance is only on the single, Inbox folder in one account, and not any of the other folders or other accounts.
  4. Profile files are on a very fast SSD. I have not been able to detect a peak in disk usage when the pause happens.
  5. The affected folder has 32K emails in it, size on disk 1.5G (+27M for `.msf` file). I have another folder which is 3.1G+20M, that one does not have this problem.

Here's what I have tried, with no changes

  1. Compact all mailboxes
  2. Repair folder for all folders/subfolders
  3. Delete the GLODA to force a rebuild
  4. Troubleshooting mode
  5. Watching the console in developer tools (no relevant errors appear)
  6. Turning on `browser.dom.window.dump.enabled` - no significant errors appear
  7. Turning off hardware acceleration
  8. Updating graphics card drivers
  9. Ensuring that the TB profile folder and windows temp folder is not being indexed by Windows search
  10. Checking the filter logs - no errors

Any suggestions or tips on how to gather more data, are welcome. Thanks!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:131.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/131.0;solver_id:6246292

title: Local Folders don't show up as expected
creator: dlooney601
content:
Trying to place my local folders directly in my mac os user directory as a mounted, encrypted drive, with the rest of Thunderbird under the Library subdirectory. Looking in this directory (mounted gocryptfs) shows the expected files.

When I first open Thunderbird, there's nothing in local folders. The account setting for local folders indicates /Users/me/Mail. Nothing showing in Local Folders. I select browse, and again choose /Users/me/Mail directory. Still nothing showing in Local Folders.

I close Thunderbird, then reopen Thunderbird. Local Folders now there and showing all expected files. So there's your work-around, but why isn't Thunderbird just opening Local Folders as expected ? Ownership and permissions on directories seem the same as on all my other accounts.

David

title: Installer not working on Windows 11 24H2

content:
Hello, The installer seems broken on the latest version of Windows 11 (Version: 24H2) where it says that the installer is corrupt. I must say that this is not the only installer not working on this latest version of Windows, (all compressed installer seems to not work properly).

The steps to reproduce are very simple, just clean install a PC on this latest version and try the installer. (Tested on two different computers)

Meanwhile I found a bypass where you can extract the installer manually with WinRar and use it from here.

I would like to know if someone at Mozilla is working on a fix for this issue or if a patch from Microsoft is required.

If no one is able to provide a answer, please consider this message as a bug report.

Thanks for time !

title: Migrate Postbox to Thunderbird: emails in 2 accounts only have headers, no conent.
creator: rreinbold
content:
Installed latest version of TB and want to migrate account settings and messages from Postbox to Thunderbird. I used the TB import tool and selected the active Postbox profile to import. All three accounts were imported. All the emails in one account were imported. In the case of the other two accounts, one of which is active and one is inactive, TB only imported the message headers only, not the contents.

I then found a migration app from a software company that was supposedly designed specifically to migrate Postbox accounts and messages to TB. When I ran the app, I got the exact same results as when I did it manually.

Any ideas on why the message content is missing on all emails in the two other accounts? The account settings are unchanged from Postbox.

Thanks!
